Hello SAP S/4HANA Cloud Community,

Introduction:
I work with the LO-MD-BP-2CL component in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, focusing on Business Partner functionality. I’d like to share some insights with the community regarding maintenance of the International Bank Account Number (IBAN), as I’ve come across several incidents involving incorrect validations for various countries.

In this blog, I will show a simple example from specific country and outline the steps to correctly implement maintenance of the International Bank Account Number (IBAN).

Steps:

  1. Open Basic Settings Application Platform and Infrastructure: General Settings -> SSCUI 102592 Set Country-Specific Checks and select configure button as shown in image.

2. Select Country France for purpose of the example

 

3. Check out the SAP recommended settings for countries in which the International Bank Account Number (IBAN) is used by checking out the Knowledge Based Article  1012293 - IBAN and maintenance of bank master data.

**Screenshot from KBA 1012293 for France Country**

4. Please fill out above details in fields Key for bank directory, Bank account number and Bank number length - Length and Checking rule.


Best regards,

entry.title: Display Changes to Objects
entry.content:
This is a new analytical application in Business Event Logging. It lets you review the recorded field changes for an object.

Screen Areas

Information filter

You can use the information filter at the top of the screen to select which data is displayed in the chart and table. This allows you to view recorded field changes for objects in various ways. You must enter the Object and Time Interval, as they are mandatory filters. Additionally, you can use other filters, such as "Object Component" and "Changed By", among others.

Fig. 2: Filter bar

Visual filter

Visual filter provides a graphical interface for interacting with and filtering your data. It allows you to view and filter the frequency of Changes to Fields based on "Change Type", "Year and Calendar Week" as well as by "Object Component" such as Item or Schedule Line.

Fig. 3: Visual filter bar

Bar chart

The bar chart offers a concise overview of the frequency of specific change fields. By selecting a bar, you can filter the entries in the table. Additionally, utilize the View By filter to explore different dimensional data. You also have the option to change the chart type from the default bar chart for other kinds of charts.

Fig. 4: Bar chart in Hybrid view

Fig. 5: Bar chart in Chart-only view

The "Hybrid view," also referred to as "Chart and Table View," is the default setting that displays both the chart and the table simultaneously. Additionally, you have the option to toggle between "Chart-only view" and "Table-only view" within the chart area.

Fig. 6: Toolbar in chart area

Table

The table located at the bottom of the screen provides additional details regarding the logged changes to objects, including Change Field, Change Type, Object IDs, Changed By, Old Value, and New Value. In the "Settings" button, you have the option to customize the displayed columns to include information such as Object Keys, Activity ID, Source of Data, and more. Additionally, you can utilize the "Group By" and "Sort by" features for the columns.

Fig. 7: Table in Table-only view

Upon clicking on column "Object IDs" you will be directed to the details page of the Fiori app "Display Business Events by Business Object".

Fig. 8: Details page of Display Business Events by Business Object

Upon clicking on each row in the "Change Type" column, you are directly directed to the event details page (Fiori app "Display Business Event Logs"),  or a dialog popover appears, displaying concise event information.

Fig. 9: Event Type and Versions in a Dialog

Upon selecting a table entry, you will be directed to the details page of the Fiori app "Display Business Event Logs".

Fig. 10: Details page of Display Business Event Logs

SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, Private Edition2025 FPS0 and later
SAP S/4 HANA (On-Premise)2025 FPS0 and later

entry.title: Staff your SAP Cloud ERP Enterprise Projects with the right Employees
entry.content:
Effective project and resource management is crucial for companies to deliver successful projects. Organizations running Enterprise Projects and/or Customer Projects in SAP Cloud ERP have the possibility to leverage SAP Project and Resource Management to optimize the project success. Resource Management is a process which spans normally over the complete lifetime of a project, starting with the initial finding and assignment of people, doing the continuous staffing forecasts and handling conflicts like substituting people. This blog provides an overview of how SAP Project and Resource Management facilitates these different staffing capabilities during the project life cycle of Enterprise Projects in SAP Cloud ERP.

Introduction:

Enterprise projects in SAP Cloud ERP   can be used to manage different kinds of projects in different industries. Examples are:

    • Overhead projects: for example, administrative projects or projects for research and development,
    • Investment projects: for example, projects to develop or maintain physical assets,
    • Projects with revenue: for example, engineer-to-order projects,
    • Statistical projects: can be used for certain reporting needs, without carry actual costs itself

Details about the different Project Types are documented in the following blog:
The two project control possibilities in SAP S/4HA... - SAP Community

 

Optimizing Resource Allocation:

Even in a simple project scenario, where an enterprise project merely serves as a cost collector without a formal project structure, managing resources is still required. Team members can log hours against the project, so optimizing resource allocation is crucial. To do this, you need clear visibility of available and skilled resources

Resource Management capability of SAP Project and Resource Management covers the following key aspects:

  • Transparency: Overview of projects people are working on and identification of conflicts
  • Reduce time to staff for Projects:
    • Staffing: Find available and skilled people and staff persons as requested and consider their availability
    • AI-assisted skill matching: overcome challenges like outdated employee profiles and reviewing many profiles manually
  • Increase staffing accuracy: Project workers can directly maintain their forecasts based on when they are needed for a project
  • Increase time-booking quality: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Timesheet worklist includes projects on which person is staffed
  • Single source of truth: the close integration between resource management information with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Project data provides synchronized data
  • SAP unified User Experience
  • Simple to adapt 

 

Basic scenarios and concepts:

SAP Project and Resource Management is a SaaS offering on SAP Business Technology Platform. Once the subscription is in place a scope item facilitates the setup.

Users can choose if resource management apps for business users should directly run in the SAP Cloud ERP Launchpad, e.g. Project Managers using the Project-related apps can also directly see the resource management apps they need.

 

Setup:

To proceed with the setup the following sources contain more details.
Administration Guide:
https://help.sap.com/docs/PPRM_OD/542f4545bc9d4ecd80bc3a0a6913a735/434f2ec669444cc98583a1c4eadca05a.html

The blog “Setup Resource Management Capability in SAP Project and Resource Management” provides a summary how to proceed by setting up the integration:
https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/setup-resource-management-capability-in-sap-projects-and-resource/ba-p/13999829

 

Process:

Harmonizing staffing with project setup and milestone planning can reduce Backoffice efforts and allow people to focus on what is needed to deliver projects successfully instead of spending effort in maintaining consistent information across different sources.  

The process starts in SAP Cloud ERP when a Resource demand is created:

 


Screen shows the resource demand defined in the Enterprise Project

Once the Enterprise Project Integration is setup for SAP Cloud ERP “human resource” demands create the Resource Requests in Resource Management.

The process is explained along the most used apps in this blog.

1. Manage Resource Requests (Role: Project Manager)

Resource Request contains the need for a specific resource and is normally being refined by a user, e.g. Project Manager. During the refinement information about needed skills, scope description, requested resource organization are added. Once the request is complete the Project Manager can “publish” the request, so it becomes visible to the Resource Managers. No need to send additional information via email and capture the information directly where it is needed.


Screen shows the resource request which was published and includes “SAP Cloud ERP” as a required skill

 

2. Staff Resource Requests (Role: Resource Manager)

Resource Managers review the request and start now with the search of candidates. Availability and Skill matching are performed and available candidates identified. Resource Manager can propose or directly staff one or multiple candidates:

  • Proposing a candidate, allows Project Manager to accept / decline candidates
  • Soft booking is not yet confirmed staffing and only visible in resource management, while Hard booking is a confirmed booking type and people will see staffing in the SAP Cloud ERP timesheet app.
  • Forward requests, in case no suitable candidates are identified a request can be forwarded to another organization

Learn more how the AI-Assisted Advanced Skill Matching facilitates the search of skilled candidates check:
Unlock Efficient Resource Management with AI in SA... - SAP Community


Screen shows the matching candidates list and the Advanced Skill Match for Lilian Blair – Lilian is being assigned by using the “Quick Assign” feature

 

3. Manage Resource Utilization (Role: Resource Manager)

Provides transparency how people are utilized, visualizes conflicts of over / under bookings and shows directly on which projects and roles people are working.

Resource Managers can also create, change and move assignments in order to resolve conflicts and adjust the planning.


Screen shows a list of filtered employees which includes Lilian Blair and her staffing for the Project Expert role

 

4. My Assignments (Role: Project Team Member)

Once employees are staffed and have the needed authorization, they can maintain a staffing forecast means they can adjust in which weeks they work how many hours on a project. This allows them to refine and balance between different project assignments and align their involvement along with the planned project milestones, considering planned absences etc.

The updated information is afterwards visible for Resource- and Project Managers to ensure everyone has the updated information.



Screen shows mobile view of Lilian’s “My Assignment” app.

Staffed hours and candidates will be visible in SAP Cloud ERP. The Enterprise Project demand will get directly information about the assigned people and hours. This helps to bring up staffing information in the employee’s timesheet worklist to simplify timesheet capturing and reduce the time to find the right project.

 

Summary:

Resources assignments and staffed hours are kept in synch between the SAP Cloud ERP and Resource Management, which ensures that all users have the same view on resource demands and what is being staffed.

SAP Project and Resource Management supports you by gaining transparency on your resource utilization situation with a fully integrated and embedded into the SAP User Experience scenario.

To learn more and to explore Resource Management in SAP Project and Resource Management you can find more information and access the free trial under:

https://www.sap.com/prm

 

Companies running Customer Projects in SAP Cloud ERP can also consult the following blog:
https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/overcoming-challenges-in-staffing-customer-projects-with-sap-project-and/ba-p/13748436

entry.title: API Consumption - S/4 HANA Cloud,Public Edition and S/4 HANA Cloud,Private Edition
entry.content:
With the evolving SAP landscape and customers moving to S/4 HANA Cloud , our prime focus as a consultant is to follow a clean core approach.

SAP Business Accelerator Hub(https://api.sap.com/) is one such platform which helps us in discovering standard APIs,Events, Extensibility options

which we can consume in our S/4 HANA landscape to achieve end-to-end business functionality. This blog focusses mainly on the API consumption from

SAP Business Accelerator HUB and how it differs between the two of the S/4 HANA Cloud offerings - S/4 HANA Cloud,Public Edition and S/4 HANA Cloud,Private Edition.

We will first go through some of the basic differences and then focus on technically how we can use or consume these APIs in each of the environments.

 

S/4 HANA Cloud Public Edition

S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition

Where to find?

 

Ready to use APIs available in Business Accelerator Hub(https://api.sap.com/) to be explored under the Tile -

 

Ready to use APIs available in Business Accelerator Hub(https://api.sap.com/) to be explored under the Tile –

 

Activation

 

Communication management based API Activation. APIs are part of a standard communication scenario. Communication scenario can be found from SAP Business Accelerator HUB as below –

 

 

SICF based API activation(OData V2)For OData V4 no specific activation is needed but the Service Group needs to be published. Not associated to any communication scenario.

 

 

Sandbox availability

“TryOut” option available in SAP Business Accelerator HUB for OData APIs to execute the CRUD methods with Sandbox data. Also you can deploy your own system to do tryout with your actual data of your S/4 HANA Cloud,Public Edition system.

 

 

 

No Tryout option available with any Sandbox. Also here the S/4 HANA system is in a private network and often there will be a Cloud Connector in between so TryOut options have been restricted for APIs for Private Edition

 

 


 

 

 

Consumption

API is consumed through a communication arrangement which is based on a standard communication scenario. Standard Fiori Application -   Communication Arrangements to be used for consumption.

For OData V2 API is activated through transaction code - /n/IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE.

For OData V4 API no separates activation is required but service group needs to be published through transaction code - /n/IWFND/V4_ADMIN

Practice Guide

We will be using OData V2 - API - API_PRODUCT_SRV as an example to demonstrate the activation of the API in S/4 HANA Public Cloud and S/4 HANA Private Cloud.

API Link for Public Edition – https://api.sap.com/api/API_PRODUCT_SRV/overview

API Link for Private Edition - https://api.sap.com/api/OP_API_PRODUCT_SRV_0001/overview

 

Scenario 1# Activating API in Public Cloud –

Navigate to the link https://api.sap.com/api/CE_PRODUCT_0002/overview  for the API or you can search the API as below.

In https://api.sap.com/ go to the tile SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Public Edition

 

Under APIs go to ODATA V2 and search with “Product” and open the one Product Master(A2X) which say ODATA V2 API and is “Active”  for usage.

 

From SAP Business Accelerator HUB you will get the SAP standard communication scenario for the API –

 

Here we will be creating arrangement for communication scenario – SAP_COM_009

Next create a communication user from the Fiori application “Create Communication User”.

 

Give a Username and you can use the “Propose Password” option or you can add your own password.

 

Next step is to create a communication system from the Fiori application “Communication Systems”

 

Click on “New” and provide a System ID and System Name –

 

 

Go to tab “Users for Inbound Communication” and assign the user you just created in the previous step using “Create Communication Users”.

 

 

For the ease of use you can check the checkbox “Inbound Only” which means you are not expecting any outbound communication (S/4HANA -> External) through this communication system and so you will not be asked to enter any user for Outbound communication user for this communication system.

Save the communication system.

Next step is to create the communication arrangement. Go to application “Communication Arrangements”

 

Click on “New”

In the following tab enter “SAP_COM_0009” as the standard communication scenario for API_PRODUCT_SRV.

 

Select the ‘Communication System'(from value help) which we have just created in the previous step. The assigned Communication User will now automatically appear in User Name field.

 

Click “Save” and it will activate your communication arrangement.

You can get your actual service URL for all Inbound Services associated, under the tab “Inbound Services” under the column “Service URL/Service Interface”.

Similarly all the Outbound services associated with this communication Scenario “SAP_COM_0009” will show under the tab “Outbound Services”.Outbound services are generally either SOAP Outbound services or IDOCs.

 

 

All the services that belong to the communication scenario “SAP_COM_0009” will be listed here under the tab “Inbound Service”.

Get the URL where the Service says “Product Master(A2X)” / OData V2”

 

The API link looks like this - https://<host>/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_PRODUCT_SRV

So this makes your API ready for consumption from the external system.

Get the service URL and test it from POSTMAN using the communication user that you created in the first step. In POSTMAN you can use it for Basic Authentication under Authorization.

You can call this URL from SAP Integration Suite using a OData V2 Adapter with basic authentication with the user you created in “Communication User” application.

Note – For Public cloud the way of activating a OData V2 service and OData V4 service are same unlike Private Cloud where there is a difference.

So for OData V4 the API will be also activated by a communication arrangement only as shown above and the URL will look like this - https://<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_product/srvd_a2x/sap/product/0002/

Link to API Hub for the OData V4 API of Product Master - https://api.sap.com/api/CE_PRODUCT_0002/overview

 

Scenario 2# Activating API in Private Cloud –

First step same as Public cloud to find the API from https://api.sap.com/ .

Navigate to the link https://api.sap.com/api/OP_API_PRODUCT_SRV_0001/overview for the API or you can search the API as below.

In https://api.sap.com/ go to the tile SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition

 

Under APIs go to ODATA V2 and search with “Product master” and open the one Product Master(A2X) which say ODATA V2 API.

 

 

Next Run Transaction Code - /n/IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE

Click on “Add Service”

Provide System Alias = “LOCAL” and under Technical Service name – “API_PRODUCT_SRV” and click on “Get Services”

 

Then select the service you want to activate and click on “Add Selected Services”

You can provide the package where you want to assign the service.

 

If you want to use OAuth authentication you have to check the checkbox “Enable OAuth for Service”

The next step is to activate the service as shown below. However it is recommended to go and activate the service from SICF transaction code.

 

Your OData V2 Activation is complete and you can test it from the Gateway. You can call this service now from SAP Integration Suite with a technical user who has the necessary roles.

 

 

Bonus Scenario # Now we will see how we can activate a similar OData V4 service of Product Master.

To find the OData V4 API go to https://api.sap.com/ and go to the node – “SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition”

:291522iD133E2FCB72EF160:

 

Under APIs->ODATA V4 -> Search Product

 

Select the “Odata V4” one which is “Active” and not “DEPRECATED”

 

Under API Resources -> Attributes you will find the Service Group Name which you need to publish.

 

Now Go to Transaction - /n/IWFND/V4_ADMIN and click on “Publish Service Groups”

 

Next enter the Service Group Name you got from Business accelerator Hub and click on “Get Service Groups”

 

 

Now your OData V4 API will be ready for consumption from Integration Suite.

entry.title: Why the Future of SAP Consulting Delivery Is More Human
entry.content:
For years, SAP Consulting delivery has been seen as a technical and structured exercise: timelines, modules, go-lives, KPIs. But that view is no longer enough. The projects that fail today do not fail because of technical errors, they fail due to a lack of connection, empathy, and emotional leadership.
Success in consulting delivery is no longer just about what is delivered, but how people experience it, those who execute it and those who receive it.
In the context of S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition implementations, where speed, standardization, fit-to-standard and early adoption are essential, the human component becomes even more critical. The agility that this model demands cannot be achieved by technology alone, it requires teams and leaders who can manage uncertainty, enable rapid change, and support users through their adaptation journey to cloud technology.
Cloud-based projects require clear communication, empathetic leadership, and strong emotional management to ensure that transformation is not only implemented but successfully adopted and embraced. In this environment, emotional intelligence and executive coaching are not “nice to haves”—they are core skills to maximize delivery value.
In my role as a Senior SAP ERP Cloud Consultant, specialized in Finance (Management Accounting, Asset Accounting, Budget Control, and Financial Projects), I have led complex projects across Latin America.
I am also an Executive Coach in Emotional Intelligence and Neuro Linguistic Programming and I’ve seen first-hand that when we apply human tools to delivery:
•  Teams perform better, with less burnout.
•  Clients feel understood, not managed.
•  Trust becomes a competitive advantage.

The SAP Consulting delivery of the future will be:
•  Technical + Human
•  Structurally rigorous + Emotionally intelligent
•  Process-based + People-powered

If we want more agile organizations, more strategic consultants, and more engaged clients, we need leaders who listen, support, connect, and communicate with humanity.
Because the system we implement matters.
But the system we are as people, is what truly transforms.
And you? Are you leading in a more human way?

entry.title: Developing a Customized AR Aging Analysis Report in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud - Part 1
entry.content:
Introduction:

Hello everyone, Myself Sriram Balaji, I am currently working as an SAP FICO Consultant. Last year, I got an opportunity to work in SAP Public Cloud Greenfield Implementation Project. During the “FIT to Standard” and “UAT” sessions, we have demonstrated the SAP standard Customer / Supplier Aging Analysis Report to the client but they are not satisfied with the standard aging report. They required a tailored Aging Analysis Report for Customer and Supplier, one that aligned perfectly with their unique operational requirements. This experience highlighted the importance of understanding client expectations beyond standard functionalities and fueled my journey into customizing SAP solutions in the Public Cloud.

In this blog, we are going to explore how we can develop Customized Customer (AR) Aging Analysis Report using the “Key User Extensibility” in the SAP Public Cloud.

 

Purpose of Preparing Customer Aging Analysis Report:

Customer Aging Analysis Report, is a basic financial report which provides the information of outstanding payment from the customer’s and how long they are due for the payment by categorizing into the Aging Buckets (0 – 30 Days, 31 – 60 Days, ……. Above 365 Days).

The aging report provides vital information to management to evaluate how effective the business is at converting sales to cash. The aging report is also used as a tool for estimating potential bad debts, which are then used to revise what is known as the allowance for doubtful accounts.

 

Key-User Extensibility in SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud:

Extensibility covers a broad spectrum of topics that enable customers and partners to adapt standard business software to their business needs.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud key user extensibility allows adapting standard functionalities to user requirements without the need for any external tools. Key User Extensibility is done in the customizing tenant of the development system through SAP Fiori apps designed to facilitate someone making small changes to apps, reports, and email and form templates without any coding experience.

Here's an overview of the things you can do using key user extensibility tools:

  • Change and adapt the UIs for SAP Fiori Apps
  • Create Custom Fields
  • Create your own custom templates or extend the standard forms and email templates
  • Create customer-specific CDS Views
  • Enhance the current business process by creating custom business logic
  • Create a new custom user interface
  • Create custom business objects

SAP S/4HANA embodies key user extensibility tools, which are completely web-based. They are targeted at key users who have a deep knowledge of the product itself, but not necessarily a very deep technical knowledge.

For more details about Extensibility in SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud, please refer the link https://extensibilityexplorer.cfapps.eu10.hana.ondemand.com/ExtensibilityExplorer/#/ReadMore

To develop the Customized Customer Aging Analysis Report, we are going to use the below Key-User Extensibility Apps and other provided Apps by SAP in the Public Cloud:

  • Custom CDS View APP
  • Custom Analytical Queries APP
  • View Browser APP
  • Custom Catalog Extensions APP

My prior experience in developing Aging Analysis Reports in SAP ECC and S/4HANA GUI with my technical team allowed me to apply the same logic to Custom CDS Views and Custom Analytical Queries, even without knowing any deep technical knowledge.

Let me summarize the business requirement for Customer Aging Analysis before jumping into the technical steps involved for the development:

  • The report should display: Customer Account, Customer Name, Document Number, Line Item, Document Type, GL Account, Payment Terms (with descriptions), and other required fields.
  • The report should calculate and present: Overdue Days, Not Yet Due, Aging Buckets (0-30 days, 31-60 days, …... and Above 365 days), and Total Overdue Amount.
  • The report balances must be matched with the 'Manage Customer Line Items' App (Accounts Receivable Ledger).

 

In this Part - 1, We will explore how we can utilize the Custom CDS View APP for the AR Aging Analysis Report development.

 

Custom CDS View:

Custom CDS views can serve different purposes: They can be consumed in analytics or serve as external APIs to be consumed in external systems, for instance the SAP BTP. Especially Cube or Dimension views can be used in analytical scenarios and also you can create or modify a custom CDS view by,

  • Adding fields from multiple data sources.
  • Creating your own calculated fields.
  • Refining the properties of the selected fields.
  • Creating and maintaining parameters for the usage within your view.

We have combined the multiple data sources such as I_JournalEntryOperationalView, _I_GLAccountText, and _I_PaymentTermsText to create a Custom CDS View by using the Join Condition.

 

Step – 1: Open the APP – Custom CDS View

Click on “Create”.

 

Enter the “Label”, Choose the “Scenario” – “Analytical Cube” and Click on “Create” Button.

Note: By choosing the Scenario as “Analytical Cube”, We can use this CDS View to create an Analytical Queries for the Customer Aging Analysis report.

 

Step – 2: Choose the Primary Data Source 

Click on “Add” Button

Choose the “Primary Data Source”

Note: Data Source is an object containing the key figures and characteristics from the database and it provides a multidimensional analytical view of business data.

 

Select the respective “I_JournalEntryOperationalView” Data Source from the list.

 

This I_JournalEntryOperationalView CDS view provides access to all details of a journal entry item (database table ACDOCA) joined to the details of the corresponding operational accounting document item (database table BSEG) and to the details of the corresponding journal entry header (database table BKPF) including the most important business entity, such as G/L account, Cost Center or Profit Center.

So, this I_JournalEntryOperationalView is similar to the ACDOCA Table which contains the values of all the relevant fields related to the Accounting Document.

 

Step – 3: Choose the Associated Data Sources

Click on “Associated Data Sources”

Note: Associated Data Sources will help us to combine the two different data sources into one CDS View by using a join condition set between two or more equal characteristics present in the Primary Data Source – A and Associated Date Sources – B that contains the same data type.

For Example:

The primary data source "I_JournalEntryOperationalView" does not include the "Payment Terms Description" field. Therefore, we must join it with the associated data source "I_PaymentTermsText" using a join condition to retrieve this field.

Select the “Join Condition” Icon.

 

Click on “Add”

 

Choose the common field that available in the both Primary & Associated Data Source to join.

 

Select the Value Type as “Field”

Click on F4 in the Value Field.

 

Find the corresponding "Payment Terms" mapping field in the Primary Data Source to link it with the field in the Associated Data Source.

 

Select the Value Type as “Session Variable”

Choose the Value as “System Language” and Click on “Close” button.

 

Step – 4: Choose the Elements (Fields) to be added in the CDS View

In the Elements Section, Click on “Add” button and Choose “Elements”.

In the Elements selection pop up screen,

Choose the “Elements (Fields)” from “I_JournalEntryOperationalView” you want to display in the CDS view and then Click on “OK”.

Total 142 Elements (Fields) have been selected for the CDS view.

 

Step – 5: Create User Defined Parameters

User-Defined Parameters:

Parameters usually require data input when your custom CDS view is executed. This data can then be used like a variable e.g. in filters, calculated fields or even in a join condition to another view. You can then refine them or just create your own parameters if you need them.

The Customer Aging Analysis Report will operate based on "Open Items at Key Date," mirroring the functionality found in reports like "Manage Customer Line Item" or "FBL5N."

The "Open Items at Key Date" logic ensures that when the report is run for a specific date (which can be in the past, present, or future), it will only display items that meet following criteria mentioned below:

  • The open items (Invoices, Payments, & Advances) were not yet cleared as of the specified key date will be included in the report.
  • The open items (Invoices, Payments, & Advances) were cleared after the specified key date will be included in the report.
  • The open items (Invoices, Payments, & Advances) were cleared before the specified key date will be excluded from the report.

This "Key Date" will serve as a crucial input on the report's selection screen, driving the logic for determining which open items are included in the Customer Aging Report.

In the Parameters Section, Click on “Add” button,

Enter the following information:

  • Name: Technical Name
  • Label: Name to be displayed in the output of the parameter
  • Data Type: “DATS” – Date (YYYYMMDD Format) Data type of the parameter.
  • Default Type and Value: “Manual” - Enter a manual parameter value in accordance with the data type syntax, e.g. for the data type DATS enter a manual value in the format YYYYMMDD.

Now the “Open Items at Key Date” Parameter is created. 

 

Step – 6: Add User Defined Parameters in the Elements (Fields)

In the Elements Section, Click on “Add” Button and Choose the “Parameters”.

Select the created “Open Items at Key Date” Parameter and Click on “OK” button.

Now the “Open Items at Key Date” Parameter has been added in the Elements.

 

Step – 7: Using “Filter” Applying the Logic for the Customer Aging Analysis Report

You can filter the information shown in your custom CDS view by setting up a condition, just like using the WHERE clause in SQL. This condition provides the view exactly what data to show.

Think of it like this:

The CDS view (I_JournalEntryOperationalView) which we are using that shows all the Accounting Document transactions in line item wise.

  • If you want to display only Customer related Accounting Transactions, you'd set a condition like "Account Type is equal to “D".
  • Or, if you only want to see Normal Transactions (Invoices, Payments) & Special GL Transactions (Advances), your condition would be "Special GL Code equal to “BLANK”, & “A”.

Once you set this condition (using either a simple editor or a form-based one), your CDS view will automatically filter its results, showing only the open items that match what you asked for. It's a way to fine-tune the data you see without having to look through everything.

We can use the form-based version to define simple filter conditions. In case you want to define more complex conditions, we can use expression-based version. Here, we have used expression-based version.

As per business requirement, to ensure the Customer Aging Analysis Report balances match with the "Manage Customer Line Items" balances, we've set up specific conditions for these fields: Account Type, Special GL Code, Posting Date, and Clearing Date in the Filter section using expression-based version.

 

Step – 8: Create Calculation Elements (Fields) – Overdue Days & Payment Terms Days

In the Elements section, click on “Add” button and Choose “Calculation” to create Overdue Days & Payment Terms Days fields for the report.

  1. Overdue Days

Enter the following information:

  • Name: Technical Name
  • Label: Name to be displayed in the output of the parameter
  • Choose as “Function” and Choose “Function Type – Date and Time”
  • Choose the respective “Function - DATS_DAYS_BETWEEN” and apply the below mentioned formula.
  • Then click on “Create”.

Note: The function DATS_DAYS_BETWEEN calculates the difference between two specified dates, date1 and date2, in days. The actual parameters must have the predefined data type DATS and should contain a valid date in the format YYYYMMDD.

The Formula we have applied to calculate the Overdue Days is Open Items Key Date (which was created as parameter for report execution) MINUS Net Due Date. 

 

  1. Payment Terms Days

Enter the following information:

  • Name: Technical Name
  • Label: Name to be displayed in the output of the parameter
  • Choose as “Function” and Choose “Function Type – Date and Time”
  • Choose the respective “Function - DATS_DAYS_BETWEEN” and apply the below mentioned formula.
  • Then click on “Create”.

The Formula we have applied to calculate the Payment Terms Days is Net Due Date MINUS Baseline Date.

Created Calculation Elements (Fields) for the report.

In the Element Properties Section, Maintain the Aggregation method as “No Operation” for the created Payment Term Days & Overdue Days Fields to convert the field into calculated measure for creating the Aging Buckets in the Custom Analytical Query APP.

 

Step – 9: Preview and Publish the created CDS view

In the Log section, check any error need to rectified before preview the CDS view.

Click on “Preview Data” button to display the values are coming as per the logic or not.

 

Created CDS View no of line items are matching with the Manage Customer Line Items.

Calculated Fields (Overdue Days, Payment Terms Days) are displaying with values in the CDS View according formula we have applied in the calculation function.

Once Check is successful, Go to “Next Steps” section.

Click on “Publish” button to publish the Created CDS View for Creating Analytical Queries.

In Part - 2, we'll dive into using the Custom Analytical Queries APP with our newly created Custom CDS View to build an AR Aging Analysis Report.

entry.title: Accelerating Implementation with SAP Activate in the Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Readers, 

Today we will discuss about accelerating SAP implementations using SAP Activate methodology in the Public Cloud. 

SAP implementation has been going on for over a year, the budget is as well goes to high, and you're still not sure when you'll go live, sometimes I've seen projects gets drag, teams getting frustrated, and businesses losing patience.  

Due to these challenges companies are going with Public cloud implementation as implementation has been completed in less time compared to S/4HANA implementation, with the help of SAP Activate methodology. 

 What is SAP Activate? 

SAP Activate is step-by-step guide from SAP that helps companies quickly and efficiently set up and start using SAP S/4HANA Cloud implementation. 

It provides a clear guided methodology to deploy, adopt and extend new capabilities across your organization. Start fast, build smart, and run simple, while continuously innovating with SAP Activate. 

Public Cloud + SAP Activate = Game Changer. 

SAP Activate breaks every task into Six easy-to-understand phases: 

  • Discover Phase 
  • Prepare Phase 
  • Explore Phase 
  • Realize Phase 
  • Deploy Phase 
  • Run 

Real time experience: 

Let me walk you through our recent project to show you how this works in practice. 

Week 1-2: Discover Phase 

What we consultant did: Met with business users to understand their business needs. 

Advantage of Activate: Pre-built questionnaires as no miss on any important things. 

Time saved: Instead of creating requirements from scratch, we used proven templates. 

 Week 3-4: Prepare Phase 

What we consultant did: Got our system ready and planned the project.  

Advantage of Activate: Step-by-step setup guides and automatic system configuration. 

Time saved: No technical setup delays. 

 Week 5-8: Explore Phase 

What we consultant did: Designed our business processes using workshops. 

Advantage of Activate: "Fit-to-Standard" workshops with pre-configured demos. 

Time saved: Instead of explaining concepts, we showed working examples. 

 Week 9-14: Realize Phase 

What we consultant did: Built and tested our solution. 

Advantage of Activate: Migration tools, test scripts, and training templates already ready. 

Time saved: No custom development needed as we used 95% standard functionality. 

 Week 15-16: Deploy Phase &Run 

What we consultant did: Go-Live and started support to users. 

Advantage of Activate: Pre-built support processes and go-live checklists. 

Time saved: Smooth go-live with minimal issues. 

Why Public Cloud makes everything faster? 

  • As we combine public cloud with Activate it makes things faster, below are the points why it makes faster compared to S/4Hana. 
  • No infrastructure setup is required to implement. 
  • Automatic updates as you get new features every three months without any work. 
  • Preconfigured system as about 70 to 80 % of your setup is already done. 
  • Industry standard processes are already built in. 
  • Faster testing of scenarios. 
  • By leveraging the pre-delivered content, customers can jump-start the build using pre-built solutions as well as engineered services. With that, the SAP Activate framework provides a significant reduction in project time, reducing the Total Cost of Implementation (TCI) and Total Cost of Ownership (TCO). 

List of tools that accelerates the project: 

  • Fit-to-Standard workshop as it shows how the standard SAP processes work. 
  • Starter System it gives you a pre-configured system with sample master data to play with as user can use before they buy. 
  • Migration Cockpit it migrates data in days instead of months. 
  • Quality Gates is used to checkpoints make sure that everything is on track, Catches the problems early when they're easy to fix. 

 Conclusion:  By combining SAP Activate with the Public Cloud, companies can implement SAP solutions faster, smarter, and with less stress. The clear project phases, ready-to-use tools, and preconfigured processes help avoid delays, reduce costs, and deliver quick results. 

SAP Activate in the Public Cloud, you're not just implementing software, you're accelerating business transformation.

entry.title: Joule功能全景介绍：Joule在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中的核心功能与应用
entry.content:
在快速变化的商业环境中，效率和智能化是企业成功的关键。SAP的智能副驾驶Joule在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中扮演重要角色，旨在通过自然语言交互帮助用户高效完成任务、获取信息和管理业务对象。本文将深入探讨Joule的关键功能及其应用场景。

Joule不仅是聊天机器人，更是能理解用户意图、协助完成复杂业务流程的智能助手。其核心能力分为五类：信息查询、应用导航，事务处理，分析功能以及代理功能。

 

以下将为您深入介绍Joule在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中的主要功能及其核心应用场景：

 

​​• 导航功能 (Navigational Capability)​​

  • ​​作用​​: Joule帮助用户定位与任务最相关的应用程序。
  • ​​应用场景​​: 用户可通过描述需执行任务或查找对象向Joule提出请求。Joule提供导航至常用应用程序的建议。

  • ​​示例问题​​:
    • “我在哪个应用中可以创建采购订单？”
    • “如何上传供应商发票？”
    • “查找用于分析日记账分录的应用”
    • “在哪里可以为物料AB0123创建采购订单？”
    • “显示用于定义‘咨询’活动的成本率的应用”
  • ​​前提条件​​: 访问Joule建议的应用需用户拥有相应的业务目录权限。

​​• 信息功能 (Informational Capability)​​

  • ​​作用​​: Joule通过分析总结SAP帮助门户信息，提供简洁、有依据的问题答案。其评估问题，检索相关文章，利用大型语言模型分析并总结结果，提供相关文章链接。
  • ​​应用场景​​: 对话中获取关于应用程序、产品功能等查询的有依据回复。

  • ​​示例问题​​:
    • “什么是免费销售订单？”
    • “服务订单和服务合同之间有什么区别？”
    • “如何配置采购订单的灵活工作流？”
  • ​​额外功能​​: Joule可引导用户至相关应用或在需要时代为执行操作。

​​• 事务处理功能 (Transactional Capabilities)​​

  • ​​作用​​: Joule使您能够访问后端系统并管理业务任务。您可以在对话中直接查看和处理业务对象，而无需离开对话界面并执行操作，从而简化工作流程并减少获取洞察所需的时间。

                  

  • 应用场景
    • 查看业务数据 (Viewing Business Data)​​:
      • 无需打开相关应用，您可以在Joule聊天窗口中直接显示业务对象详细数据,比如要求Joule显示如采购订单状态、采购申请项目等详细信息。
      • 目前该模式已支持采购订单、销售订单、供应商发票、检验方法、主检验特性、流程订单等共计34类业务对象（完整列表详见帮助文档）
      • 示例问题：
      • 显示逾期采购订单项
      • 显示尚未交货的销售订单​
      • 获取计划开始日期为2026年的生产订单
      • 获取我创建的生产订单确认

 

    • ​​创建洞察卡 (Creating Insights Cards)​​:
      • 该功能支持您在Joule输入查询后，显示列表和洞察的快照，用户满意可将卡片添加至“我的主页”
      • 支持的应用示例有：供应商发票列表（版本2）、管理采购订单（版本2）、管理销售订单、维护物料清单、查找维护订单、管理采购申请等。

 

    • 财务领域：创建固定资产主数据 (Creating Fixed Asset Master Data)​​:
  • 该功能支持您在Joule内创建固定资产主数据记录。
  • 您可以要求Joule创建单个资产主记录，并提供公司代码、成本中心、资产类别及可选资产描述。当信息不全时，Joule会引导创建过程，请求补充信息。
  • 示例对话：
    • 用户：“请创建一个固定资产”
    • Joule: 请提供以下信息公司代码（Company Code）,资产类别（Asset Class）,成本中心（Cost Center）资产描述（Asset Description）
    • 用户提供详情如“1010, 3200, 10101041, 笔记本电脑ABC”。

 

 

  • ​​销售领域：检查和续订即将到期的价格 (Renew Expiring Prices)​​:
    • 该功能可以帮助您管理即将到期的价格（存储为销售定价条件记录），您可以要求Joule查询即将到期价格，按日期/时间范围过滤。可延长有效期至新日期或延长一段时间（如30天、一周、三个季度或一年），也可按百分比调整条件金额或比率。
    • 示例请求：“显示2025年5月1日到期的PPR0和PCP0条件类型的价格”、“延长有效日期一个月并调整条件金额-10%”

 

  • ​​销售订单状态检查 (Sales Order Status Check)​​:
    • 该功能可以帮助销售代表或经理检查销售订单履行状态，识别阻碍问题。如存在问题，Joule可显示问题数量、最早到期日、可能原因、处理建议等，并可打开相关销售订单应用。
    • 示例请求：“销售订单12345的状态是什么？”、“销售订单12345有什么问题吗？”

 

  • 代理能力 (Agentic Capabilities)
    • 作用：Joule能够自主地与环境互动，并通过多步任务迭代推理以实现目标，具备规划、反思、工具使用以及协作和多代理等关键能力。您可以关注SAP 的产品路线图来查看代理功能的具体落地日期。
  • 分析能力 (Analytical Capabilities)
    • Joule也将在未来版本中提供基于业务数据的分析能力，能够为用户提供见解。这部分的功能尚在开发中，您可以关注SAP 的产品路线图来查看有关分析功能的最新信息。

​​Joule的技术架构与访问要求​​


Joule作为独立软件组件，通过 ​​SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)​​ 以 ​​SaaS（软件即服务）​​ 形式管理和更新，支持集中式设置，实现跨连接应用的统一用户体验。

​​许可和授权：要访问SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中的Joule，可能需要额外的许可和授权。建议咨询您的SAP客户经理以获取更多信息。

业务目录要求：为了能够访问Joule提议的应用程序或使用其特定功能，您的用户需要被分配相应的业务目录（business catalogs）。

 

Joule的未来与扩展性

Joule目前支持以11种语言显示工作内容，未来还将支持更多语言。

 Joule还具备强大的可扩展性，允许通过自定义技能、低代码平台和第三方连接进行扩展。Joule studio在SAP Build中提供，助力您根据特定需求扩展Joule的功能。

更值得一提的是，Joule的AI辅助文档接地 (Document Grounding)功能，能够结合推理能力，利用您自己的非结构化或半结构化文档（如HR政策文档）来回答用户问题。它通过将大型语言模型 (LLM) 与高级信息检索相结合，增强响应质量和准确性，最大程度地减少“幻觉”，并建立信任、减少歧义。

Joule在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中，不仅仅是一个工具，更是一个智能化的业务搭档。它将繁琐的导航、信息查找和部分事务处理任务，转化为直观的自然语言对话，极大地提升了用户体验和工作效率。

感谢阅读。

entry.title: Developing a Customized AR Aging Analysis Report in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud - Part 2
entry.content:
In this Part - 2, we'll dive into using the Custom Analytical Queries APP with our newly created Custom CDS View to build an AR Aging Analysis Report.

 

Please refer Part - 1 to Understand the Custom CDS View created for the AR Aging Analysis Report:

https://community.sap.com/t5/financial-management-q-a/developing-a-customized-ar-aging-analysis-report-in-sap-s-4hana-public/qaq-p/14163727

 

Custom Analytical Queries APP:

The Custom Analytical Queries APP is like a smart tool that helps you create your own reports and analyze your business data, even if you're not a tech expert.

Imagine you're trying to build your Customer Aging Analysis Report. Instead of writing complex computer code, this app takes all the raw numbers and information (like invoices, payments, and dates) and turns them into an easy-to-understand table or grid. It hides all the difficult technical stuff, so you just focus on what you want to see.

Here's how it helps you design your report:

Pick and choose your data: The app provides all the available fields from the business transactions. For your aging report, you'd select fields like Customer Name, Invoice Number, Posting Date, Due Date, Amount Due, and Clearing Date.

Filter what you see: You can set filters to narrow down your report. For example, you might filter to see only particular customers, or invoices past their due date by more than 365 days.

Create custom calculations: You can add restricted measures (like "Total Overdue Amount for 30-60 Days").

See results instantly: You can preview your report as you build it, so you know exactly what the final output will look like.

 

Step – 1: Open the APP – Custom Analytical Queries

Click on “Create” button.

 

Enter the “Query Name”, Choose the “Data Source” – which we have created as a CDS View.

Click on “OK”.

 

Step – 2: Name the Analytical Query

In the General Tab,

Enter the “Label” for the AR Aging Analysis Analytical Query and Click on Next Tab “Field Selection”.

 

Step – 3: Field Selection for the Analytical Query

In the Field Selection Tab,

Choose the required fields from the Available Fields by selecting the “Check box” to display in the AR Aging Report.

 

Step – 4: Arrange the Selected Fields in the Analytical Query

In the Display Tab,

Select relevant Field and Choose the “Axis” - Row / Column. Once selected the Axis, the field will be automatically moved to Row / Column Tab same as Company Code, Customer etc.

Note: Arrange the fields according to the business format and also Amounts / Numerical / Calculation related fields are arranged under the Measure Structure of Column Axis.

 

Step – 5: Choose the Input Parameter Fields for the Report

For the AR Aging Analysis Report, users need to provide input parameters such as Open Items at Key Date, Customer, Company Code, GL Account, and Posting Date to generate the report based on their selections.

In the Filter Tab,

Choose the respective Field and then Select the radio button “Uset Input Values”.

Select the “Default Value” if required.

Note: Our AR Aging Analysis report runs based on the Open Items at Key Date, showing all items not cleared by that date. If you need to pre-fill any input fields, you can use the Default Value functionality in the filter section.

For Example: Below are the selected Input Parameters for our report and the “Open Items at Key Date” and “Company Code” will be defaulted at the time of report execution based on the settings in Analytical Queries.

Step – 6: Create Calculated Measure Fields (Aging Buckets) for the Report

Creating Aging Buckets is the most challenging aspect of developing the AR Aging Analysis Report. This is primarily due to the complexity of applying the necessary formulas. To build custom aging buckets, you'll need a foundational understanding of IF & Else conditions, similar to those used in Excel, to grasp the CASE WHEN Expression formulas utilized in SAP Analytical Queries.

 

  1. Not Yet Due (Aging Bucket - 1)

In the Display Tab,

Click on “Add” button and Choose “Add Calculated Measure” to create the Aging Bucket.

Then Enter the “Label” and Click on “OK”.

We've now added a "Not Yet Due" field to the query. This field displays the Amount in Company Code Currency for any customer open items with Overdue Days less than or equal to zero.

The above logic has been applied in the analytical query using the CASE WHEN formula.

In the Expression Section,

Choose the “Edit” button to apply the formula.

Select the “Function” button then Choose the “Case Expression” and Click on “OK” button.

The formula applied in this “Not Yet Due” field is, if the Overdue days field is less than or equal to “0” then “Amount in Company Code Currency” should be displayed in the report or Else the value should be displayed as “0”. You can Choose the Measure fields by click on measures button or else you can type relevant measure field in the Expression editor. Once formula applied the Click on “OK”.

 

  1. 1 to 30 Days (Aging Bucket – 2)

Apply the same steps involved in Not Yet Due field, only the formula will be changed for this 1 to 30 Days Aging Bucket.

For the "1 to 30 Days" field, we've applied a specific formula:

If a Customer Open item's Overdue Days are greater than or equal to "1" AND less than or equal to "30," the Amount in Company Code Currency will be displayed. Otherwise, the value will show as "0." This formula uses an AND condition to accurately identify customer open items that are between 1 and 30 days overdue.

After applying the formula, simply click "OK."

 You can apply this formula and change the conditions according to the Aging Buckets (31 to 60 Days, 61 to 90 Days…etc).

The Sum of all the Aging Buckets from “1 to 30 Days till Above 365 Days” will be the “Total Overdue Amount”.

Once the respective fields created in the Custom Analytical Queries APP.

Click on “Save Draft” the changes will be saved. Then click on “Preview” option to validate the report values.

 

Step – 7: Preview and Validate the Created Custom Analytical Query

In the Input Parameters, The Open Items at Key Date and Company Code will automatically default the value according to the settings in Custom Analytical Queries APP and also it can be changeable at the time of report executing.

Once maintained the Input Parameters, Click on “GO”.

You can validate the output of the report in the Preview. So, the issues will be identified and resolved before publishing the Custom Analytical Query for the APP creation.

 

Step – 8: Publish the Created Custom Analytical Query for AR Aging Analysis Report

Click on “Publish” to publish the created Custom Analytical Query for the AR Aging Analysis Report APP creation.

 

View Browser APP:

For SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition key users, the View Browser app is essential for finding CDS views. This includes both SAP-released and custom CDS views.

The app provides a comprehensive list of available CDS views. You can see details like Category, View Types, Dimensions and Measures, Annotations, supported capabilities, and modelling patterns. It also offers robust search options. You can search by descriptions, application components, or even the tables used to build the CDS views.

Beyond searching, you can use the View Browser to analyze a CDS view's data fields. The application displays all CDS views and their underlying artifacts in tables. By default, views are organized by name, but you can also filter column values using a dropdown.

While you can't change SAP-created CDS views in the View Browser, the Custom Analytical Query app allows you to create, save, modify, and publish your own CDS views to catalogs.

 

Step – 1: Create the Application for Created Custom Analytical Query

Open the “View Browser” APP.

Search the Created AR Aging Analysis Analytical Query in the Search Bar and then Click on the respective Analytical Query to Create the Application.

You can check the Fields, and CDS View involved in this Analytical Query.

Click on “Create Application”.

Choose the “Language”

Enter the “Title” and “Subtitle” for the Report and this will be the Application Name.

Click on “OK”.

Finally, the Application is created for the developed AR Aging Analysis Report.

 

Custom Catalog Extensions APP:

This app lets you assign your apps to specific business catalogs. After creating a new app, you must link it to the necessary catalogs. To use your new app, you'll need to assign a business role that includes that Catalog.

 

Step – 1: Open the APP – Custom Catalog Extensions

Select the Created Application to assign it to the respective Business Catalog.

 

Step – 2: Assign Business Catalog to the Application

Click on “ADD”.

 

Choose the respective “Business Catalog” and then Click on “OK”.

Select the Business Catalog and then Click on “Publish” button.

Confirm by choosing the “OK” to publish.

Finally, the Created Application is assigned with the Business Catalog and published for the business usage.

 

Step – 3: Display the APP - AR Aging Analysis – Report

Once the APP is assigned with the Business Catalog, you can search the created APP in the search bar to display it for the reporting purpose.

 

References / Acknowledgements:

I'd like to extend my sincere thanks to the various SAP documentation, community blogs, and helpful tutorials that guided me through the intricacies of Key User Extensibility in SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

I highly recommend them for anyone looking to dive deeper into SAP S/4HANA Cloud extensibility:

  1. https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-members/customer-aging-and-supplier-aging-reports-at-the-line-item-level-using/ba-p/13563839
  2. https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/creating-custom-cds-views-and-analytical-query-a-step-by-step-guide/ba-p/13508914
  3. https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/e30de6eae4d24d70b65996ac8ff88848.html?locale=en-US&version=2502.500

 

Conclusion:

Developing a customized Customer AR Aging Analysis Report in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, as demonstrated, truly highlights the power and flexibility of "Key User Extensibility." While standard solutions offer a solid foundation, the ability to adapt and build tailored reports is crucial for meeting unique business requirements and ensuring user satisfaction.

By leveraging apps like Custom CDS Views, Custom Analytical Queries, the View Browser, and Custom Catalog Extensions, key users can effectively design and deploy robust financial reports without extensive technical coding. This empowers organizations to gain deeper insights into their financial data, streamline processes, and make more informed decisions regarding accounts receivable management.

This project was a testament to how SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition enables businesses to go beyond standard functionalities, proving that with the right tools and a clear understanding of business needs, powerful custom solutions are well within reach.

Thank You!

entry.title: 亮点前瞻之 SAP ERP公有云2508中国本地化发布
entry.content:
随着数字化浪潮的汹涌澎湃，企业对高效、智能的财务管理解决方案的需求日益迫切。在这个充满机遇与挑战的时代，SAP全球化部门始终秉持着对客户需求的敏锐洞察，持续为中国市场量身定制本地化增强功能。从税务到资金管理，从报表生成到法规遵循，我们致力于为您的企业打造全方位、一站式的数字化转型支持。

        在本文中，我们将带您深入了解即将发布的ERP公有云2508版本中国本地化的诸多亮点功能，它们将为您的企业带来前所未有的便捷与高效，助力您在激烈的市场竞争中脱颖而出，迈向更加辉煌的未来。

 

中国本地化财务操作更新

中国过账功能更新

        在财务管理的精细化浪潮中，精准的账务处理是企业稳健运营的关键。自2508版本起，中国用户可以在激活相关的设置之后，实现清帐过程中的负过账。

        该功能将通过为相关清帐凭证的对应行项目打上反记账标签之后，巧妙地实现清帐科目的借贷方发生额冲抵，合计为零，从而有效地避免了清帐科目的发生额虚增的现象，确保财务数据的真实性和准确性。

        用户首先需要在国家版本中国(CN)中为CN激活SSCUI: 激活国家/地区的负过账。请注意，中国本地化过账的负过账，依旧严格遵循SAP ERP标准财务功能中对负记账的规则和要求，确保您的财务流程既高效又合规。

 图一：中国版本下负记账相关的SSCUI

 

 图二：中国版本下的清帐凭证

 

中国本地化资金方案更新

新字段“金融交易类型”(Financial Transaction Type)

        资金管理作为企业运营的血脉，其精准与高效直接关系到企业的资金周转和财务健康。2508版本在SAP ERP 公有云的中国资金解决方案中提供新字段“金融交易类型” (Financial Transaction Type):

  • Fiori 创建付款申请-中国 (Create Payment Requisitions - China)
  • Fiori管理付款申请-中国 (Manage Payment Requisitions – China)
  • BAdI: 中国、新加坡、泰国：扩展付款项目审批 (China, Singapore, Thailand: Extension of Payment Items Approval)

        用户可根据企业项目的具体情况，在中国资金方案中的付款申请中对字段“金融交易类型”进行精准维护；根据需要灵活调整中国银企直连EPIC BAdI接口；并在中国现金流量表(基于DRC)的配置中将“金融交易类型”指定给相关现金项。通过这一系列操作，企业能够依据金融交易类型，将银行转账交易精准划分到中国现金流量表（基于DRC）的不同现金项目中，进而确保财务报表的准确性和可追溯性，为企业的资金管理提供坚实的数据支持。

图三：在创建付款申请中维护“金融交易类型”

 

图四：在管理付款申请中维护“金融交易类型”

 

中国增值税发票管理(基于SAP DRC)更新

销项增值税发票管理功能更新 - 红字发票通知单编号

        在税务管理的数字化转型中，发票处理的自动化是提高效率、降低错误率的关键一步。从2508版本起，在直连场景下，用户将在“创建金税凭证应用”中体验到红字发票通知单流程的自动化革新。用户可直接在应用中完成红字通知单号的创建，并自动从税局同步获取通知单编号，这一流程的优化将极大地简化您的税务操作：

 

图五：处理红字通知单

 

具体步骤如下：

  1. 用户在SAP开票组件（如SD、FICA/CI等）中参照原始发票创建贷项凭证（Credit memo）。在“创建金税凭证”应用中选择SAP贷项凭证，点击“红字通知单号”按键。
  2. 弹出界面“输入贷项凭证的红字通知单号”中，用户只需直接填写原始蓝字发票信息，选择原因代码，然后点击“应用”即可触发系统自动创建并返回红字通知单编号。
  3. 点击界面上“发送/同步”按钮，获取税局回传的正式红字发票号。

注意事项：

  1. 用户可通过SAP最新发布的自动化流程，利用乐企提供的相关API，在SAP应用内直接完成红字发票的开具操作，这一创新流程将使您的税务处理更加高效、便捷。
  2. 对于采用第三方方案实现直连（电子税务局）的客户，SAP已与部分特定的第三方厂商完成了技术验证及系统联调，技术层面已具备通过SAP与第三方方案的集成方式实现自动开具红字发票的条件。然而，具体实施细节和适用性仍需客户在项目过程中与所选第三方厂商进一步确认。

 

进项增值税发票管理功能更新 - 同步进项税申报状态

        在税务申报的数字化进程中，实时、准确的申报状态同步是确保企业合规运营的重要保障。从2508版本起，在直连场景下，用户在管理进项增值税申报应用中，可以轻松申报当前有效税收期间的发票。选择申报按钮后，该期间状态将自动更改为中间状态“已发送以供申报”。税务部门完成期间申报处理后，申报结果将自动发送回SAP系统，期间状态也将随之自动更新。

        用户可通过查看新增的进项增值税申报日志，详细检查申报信息。每次更改期间状态时，系统都会生成相应的日志条目。对于直连场景的用户，“金税系统处理结果”和“详细信息”字段将包含税局返回的申报结果信息。

图六：查看进项税申报日志

 

        如果申报结果长时间未更新，用户可以利用新增的“同步期间状态”按钮手动触发更新。此外，在管理进项增值税发票应用中，用户还可以在清单页面中批量同步多个发票的状态，这一功能的引入将进一步提升您的税务管理效率。

 

图七：同步进项税状态

 

展望未来，充满希望

        展望未来，SAP全球化部门将继续以创新为驱动，以客户需求为导向，为您提供更加智能化、自动化的本地化解决方案。在云时代的浪潮中，我们将持续为您赋能，助力您的企业在合规运营和本地化管理的道路上稳步前行，共同迎接充满无限可能的明天。

        关于S/4HANA 2508中国本地化功能的更多详情信息，欢迎请参考链接。

entry.title: SAP Document and Reporting Compliance for Vietnam: The Service Provider's Integration Blueprint
entry.content:
Are you a third-party service provider looking to integrate with Document and Reporting Compliance for Vietnam? This blog is your essential playbook for understanding the SAP interface, valid statuses, request/response structures, and expected business scenarios. By following this blueprint, your integration will be seamless, standardized, and ready for production.

What You Will Achieve

This blog will help you enable seamless electronic invoice exchange between SAP and your system, fully compatible with the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, Cloud Edition Extensibility framework. Your system will receive electronic invoices from SAP in a SAP defined format, validate and process them, and respond with the required statuses and payloads. This ensures full traceability for customers and allows for the transfer of electronic invoices to the Vietnam General Department of Taxation (GDT), known in Vietnamese as Tổng cục Thuế.

API Endpoint Setup

Before starting, ensure you have an API endpoint that wraps all operations for SAP to send and receive payloads, in the following format:

<host>/v1/command

Replace <host> with your actual service's host or domain name. 

Example Request Payload From SAP to Service Provider  

When SAP calls your API, the request is in JSON format with HTTP POST operation and a content type of multipart/form-data. The payload includes processing instructions and additional document attachments in XML format, which could be accessed using the boundary value:

POST <host>/v1/command
Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=boundary

--boundary
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="payload"
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "processInstance": {
    "id": "<SAP Internal document ID>",
    "processType": "CUSTOMER_INVOICE",
    "processSubtype": "B2B",
    "countryRegion": "VN",
    "processVersion": "1.0.0",
    "action": "TRANSMIT",
    "senderRegistrationID": "123456789",
    "documents": [
      {
        "id": "<SAP Internal source key>",
        "type": "SUBMIT_MAIN"
      }
    ]
  }
}
--boundary
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="<SAP Internal document ID>+<SAP Internal source key>"; filename="filename.XML"
Content-Type: application/xml
--boundary--

Where is the Actual XML?

The XML file is attached as a separate multipart section, not as a string in the JSON. Each entry in the documents array of the JSON is mapped by its id to a matched file (in this case, the invoice XML).

As you noticed in the example above, there is a field called "action" (e.g., TRANSMIT). SAP can send you one of three actions, and for each action, only certain response statuses are allowed from the service provider:

Action from SAP to SPPermitted Response Statuses from SP to SAP
TRANSMITTRANSMITTED, REJECTED
RETRANSMITRETRANSMITTED, REJECTED
UPDATE_TRANSMISSION_STATUSTRANSMISSION_IN_PROGRESS, ACCEPTED, REJECTED
 
Below you’ll find a scenario map and guideline for when each status is to be returned:
StatusWhen to use / ScenarioRequired Additional Info 
TRANSMITTEDService Provider validations have passed.

INVOICE_NUMBER

REJECTED

Service Provider or GDT validations have failed

Detailed error messages

RETRANSMITTEDService Provider validations have passed. This status is used when a retransmission action has occurred successfully from SAP to Service Provider(in response to RETRANSMIT).

INVOICE_NUMBER

ACCEPTEDDocument approved by the Vietnamese tax authority (GDT). (Attach CQT code and PDF in documents.)

CQT_CODE and PDF attachment  

TRANSMISSION_IN_PROGRESSInvoice is not yet sent to tax authority or is still under evaluation (used only in UPDATE_TRANSMISSION_STATUS).

INVOICE_NUMBER

Example Response Payload From Service Provider to SAP

Here are real-life examples for your API responses, aligned with the status scenario map above. The examples below cover all possible response scenarios required by SAP DRC Vietnam. Please note that, like request payload, response payload also has to be sent to SAP in multipart/form-data format.

1. TRANSMITTED

When service provider validations have passed for a TRANSMIT action

{
  "processInstance": {
    "id": "<Internal document ID generated by SAP>",
    "processType": "CUSTOMER_INVOICE",
    "processSubtype": "B2B",
    "countryRegion": "VN",
    "processVersion": "1.0.0",
    "status": "TRANSMITTED",
    "messages": [
      {
        "code": "INVOICE_NUMBER",
        "texts": [
          {
            "language": "EN",
            "text": "<SP should update invoice number value here>"
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
}

2. RETRANSMITTED

When service provider validations have passed for a RETRANSMIT action

{
  "processInstance": {
    "id": "<Internal document ID generated by SAP>",
    "processType": "CUSTOMER_INVOICE",
    "processSubtype": "B2B",
    "countryRegion": "VN",
    "processVersion": "1.0.0",
    "status": "RETRANSMITTED",
    "messages": [
      {
        "code": "INVOICE_NUMBER",
        "texts": [
          {
            "language": "EN",
            "text": "<Update Invoice Number value here>"
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
}

3. REJECTED

Also, only include the documents tag in your response when it is shown in the example. If a scenario example omits documents, then you must not attach any additional documents for that particular response.

Mandatory Fields in Requests and Responses

Every interaction between SAP and the service provider relies on a standardized set of fields to ensure seamless communication and traceability.
When building your integration, make sure your API receives and sends the following key elements in every request and response:

FieldDescription
idA unique SAP internal document ID for each transaction. Echo this back in every response.
processTypeIndicates the document type; e.g., CUSTOMER_INVOICE.
processSubtypeSpecifies the transaction context; e.g., B2B.
countryRegionAlways VN for Vietnam compliance flows.
processVersionSpecifies the document type version; e.g., 1.0.0
senderRegistrationIDCustomer registration ID from the SAP request payload.
statusYour response status, selected from the allowed list for the given action.
documents[Conditional] List of all files included in the transmission (such as PDF attachments), each mapped by id.
messages[Conditional] Use for conveying errors, validation feedback, or status updates, particularly when the transaction fails or the document is rejected.

Final Checklist to Go Live

  • Implement only allowed status codes per action.
  • Ensure all required fields are present and correctly formatted.
  • Include and map attachments precisely.
  • Robust error handling and logging.

By following this playbook, you’ll ensure rapid, compliant, and support-minimal onboarding for any Vietnam service provider integrating with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Cloud Edition Extensibility Vietnam.

entry.title: Analyzing Availability in the Display Product Availability App
entry.content:
In the previous blog that introduced the Display Product Availability, we talked about providing you with the capability to dive deep into how a product’s availability is determined. That plan has been realized, and the Analyze Product Availability feature is here! 

When you view the availability of products in the Display Product Availability app, you can now go to a specific plant and view details, such as the supply and demand elements (referred to as MRP elements) that affect the product’s availability.  

You can also explore further and see how the scope of availability check is configured for the product. The scope of check also tells you the check horizon setting, which helps you understand the calculation of the confirmed quantity of a product.  

Let’s go through the features one by one. 

See MRP elements and other details

To get started with analyzing product availability, in the Display Product Availability app, choose a specific Plant where you want to examine the availability situation. 

For that Plant, you will find details of the availability situation. You can use this information to:  

  • Understand the confirmations of requirements. For example, you can see why you have certain available quantities on a given date, or be aware of a concurrent demand that consumes the stock or receipt quantity. 
  • Analyze the availability situation so that you can reliably respond to customer demands or share internally with other stakeholders.

There are several actions you can carry out: 

  • Drill down on each MRP element to see which document contributes to the availability situation. 
  • Hover over the Available Quantity — You’ll find the total receipts and requirements, and the quantity that is reserved for future requirements. The reserved quantity considers protected quantity reserved for prioritized customers if supply protection is included in the scope of check. For information about supply protection, see Supply Protection (SUP). 
  • Adjust the date range in the Receipts and Requirements table to find out the planned changes in availability. 
  • Examine the scope of check. 

Show scope of check

You can choose „Show Scope of Check“ to see which stocks, receipts, requirements, and other MRP elements are considered for the availability check. For example, if supply protection is included (With Supply Protection for Specific Document Types under Special Scenarios is checked) in the scope of check, then the protected quantity will be included in calculating the product’s availability. 

The scope of check is based on the checking group assigned to the product in the material master, and the checking rule. The checking rule is based on the availability context (sales, or delivery) you selected in combination with the special stock type, if selected. 

You can expand Result After Check Horizon to know the check horizon settings in the material master for this plant. Depending on the settings here, demands and receipts after the check horizon may or may not be considered in the Available-To-Promise check.  

If the Result After Check Horizon is set to Full Confirmation, then the requirements after the check horizon are confirmed fully. Once they move inside the check horizon, the requirements immediately reserve quantity. If the setting is Zero Confirmation, then the requirements after the check horizon are not confirmed; they remain backordered. If Ignore Check Horizon is checked, then requirements are confirmed according to the available stocks and supply elements. These settings explain why the available quantity can be negative, zero, or unlimited, other than positive.  

By offering greater transparency into the factors that impact product availability, you can better track your products’ availability. 

Link to product assistance: Analyzing Product Availability

entry.title: The SAP Extended Warehouse Management FAQ Series: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Integration
entry.content:
Many customers are running standardized processes for their Finance, Controlling and Order Management processes in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud are searching for options to integrate advanced warehouse management functionalities to cover their logistics process requirements and help them to grow their business.

With SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition 2508 a new scope item enabling integration of SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud with EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud will be available, to combine standardized cloud ERP processes to be integrated with advanced warehouse management capabilities.

With this blog post are discussing questions and interesting information around the integration of SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud.

Which release is required to setup the SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud integration?

With SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508 a new scope item will be shipped - SAP EWM for SAP S/4HANA Integration (7L1). This includes the new communication scenario Logistics - S/4HANA Extended Warehouse Management Integration (SAP_COM_0A58) that enables the integration of transactional data to a decentral EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud or OnPremise.

Minimum required SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud release is 2023, FPS0 if batch master data distribution is not required. Otherwise, SAP S/4HANA Private Cloude release 2023, FPS3, introducing the batch master data distribution via DRF is the required minimum release.

Which functional scope is supported in the integration?

The following processes are supported in the SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud integration to a decentral EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud:

Process

Scope Item

Inbound processing from supplier

2VJ - SAP EWM Integration - Inbound Processing from Supplier

Outbound processing to customer

2VK - SAP EWM Integration - Outbound Processing to Customer

Delivery based production integration: Production supply and goods receipt

2VM - SAP EWM Integration - Delivery-Based Production Integration

Customer returns

2VO - SAP EWM Integration - Customer Returns 

Batch management - Creating batches in: 

•       SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ERP system

•       SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition EWM system

2VN - SAP EWM Integration - Batch Management

Stock transport orders

2VL - SAP EWM Integration - Stock Transport Orders 

What do I have to know about the technical setup of the integration?

To setup the integration there are cut-over, customizing and integration settings required to establish the integration from SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud to SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud via SAP Cloud Connector and vice versa via WebSocket. Please find detailed information about the integration via official Set-Up Instruction - Setting Up SAP EWM for SAP S/4HANA Integration (7L1).

Which deployment scenarios are supported?

We are supporting the integration of a single SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud tenant (with or without Cloud WM) to a single EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud instance. Additionally, a further SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud instance can be integration to the same EWM for SAP S/4HANA.

Please note that the SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud instance can only be used as a decentral EWM logistics system as the integration of multiple SAP S/4HANA or SAP ECC systems to EWM on SAP S/4HANA embedded not supported (see also SAP Note 3376453 - SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS00, FPS01, FPS02 and FPS03: Release information and restrictions for EWM in SAP S/4HANA).

Are there any restriction to be considered implementing this integration to EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud?

There are functional restrictions for EWM on SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud integrating with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud to be considered. These can be distinguished by supported processes and integration capabilities managed via Control Parameters for ERP Version Control.

Please find a list of most important processes and functions not supported in the integration in the table below:

Process/Functions

Details

Handling Unit Management in EWM in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

Handling Units can only be managed within SAP EWM. They are not integrated into SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition. Handling Units created in EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud are not transferred to deliveries in the SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

Serial Numbers on warehouse level

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition offers Serial Numbers on the document level (A), the warehouse level (B) and the stock level (C). SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition only offers Serial Numbers on the (A) document and (C) stock levels.​ Serial Number on document and stock level supported for integration scenario only.

Transport Integration – Shipment (LE-TRA) – Transportation Unit

Integration of Transportation Units via SHPMNT05-Idoc to LE-TRA component (Shipments) is not supported in SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud integration.

Integration with SAP Transportation Management (TM)

The integration with Transportation Management (e.g. Via Transportation Units or Advanced Shipping and Receiving) I not supported.

Find a complete list of restrictions and learn more about the new integration between SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud via SAP Note 3629180 - Supported Processes for EWM Integration with SAP_COM_0A58 - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and Higher.
